values: And, more recently: I'm still at Metro State, working on my bachelor's in photojournalism (and possibly a minor in French). I moved to Denver in September, and I'm now living in student housing with three roommates (eesh.) and trying to find a new job to feed my travel habit. Look me up on facebook, or on flickr. Hope you're all doing well. -a

yeah, it's been more than a year.

i never post on here anymore.  i do, however, have a new blog: http://antennastoheaven.wordpress.com

also, my flickr is active, lots of pictures from my recent trip to the west coast.

i might pop in here once in a while, though.

well, not really.


okay, kinda.  i have a confession to make.


for everyone who thought i was already at Metro: I have been attending the prestigous Community College of Denver (because I can't stand ACC) for the past three semesters.  As of two weeks ago, I am a student of Metro State.  I'm moving up in the world.


I have kind of a foolish dream.  I've decided that a journalism degree (my straight-out-of-high school idea of a major) is far more marketable than a straight photo degree (no offence, Lexi).  Therefore, I have decided upon a suitable college for my degree: Northwestern University.


Now comes the fun part.  In order to have even a glimmer of hope of getting accepted, I'll have to pull a 4.0 this semester.  If I happen to get accepted, the next hurdle will be finances.  NU costs on the order of fourty-eight thousand a year, all expenses paid.  Crap.

So there you have it.  If I get in, it has to be fall '07.  NU only awards degrees to students who have been there for two years or more.  And let's face it, I can't afford more than that.


Aaaaaaaaaaand I have to work tomorrow morning.  Bedtime!

I went on a little adventure yesterday.  Lexi and I went up to Longmont to meet up with the Captain and Autowitch, but of course, we had to make a pitstop at the Eagle Mine.  We perused the buildings there for a while, and then proceeded to Longmont.

The other two were running late, so we decided to check out the abandoned sugar mill in Longmont.  Fantastic building, but a lot of activity nearby.  So we went and met up with the team and piled into the Land Cruiser (i want one now, specifically for this purpose) and went up Boulder Canyon.  

We then spent some time at the 'Jolly Rancher' mine, went about 20 feet into the mine itself, and took some shots of equipment in the area.  We then set out to find American City.  It turned out to be on private property, with signs of someone having been there very recently.  So we continued up the road to find an abandoned miner's cabin.  One room, but it looked like it held at least a family of three.  There were a lot of belongings left there.  It turned out to be very eerie with the fog (or cloud) moving in on us.

The next site was another old mine with some buildings clustered around it.  One of the buildings was filled with shelves containing thousands upon thousands of core samples.  The shelves had been warped by age and the weight of the rocks.  It all looked a bit surreal.

And yes, there will be pictures, but I'll need to develop them first.

Patience.

i've decided that i'll be doing another year of college (this upcoming one) in denver, and then, finances permitting...




i'm moving to chicago.


needless to say, i really, really like it here.  i could stay here for years and not take enough pictures.

i'm beginning to think i'm one of those people i'm always talking about. one of those people who just think that they're good photographers. like i'm just kidding myself. i used to think that i could show some of my work in a coffee house, and someone would walk past and say 'damn, that is a good shot. i want that on my wall.' but it seems that a lot of the stuff i've been shooting would produce a response leaning more toward 'hmm. that's nice.' i'd like to shoot just one picture that actually makes people look at it more than once. well, now that that's out of the way (things like that seem to come out after a glass of wine), i know what everyone on the rest of the internet thinks, now i want all your input. tear into them. be ruthless. i want to know what makes any of them good or bad. 1. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7.

so.  fresh insomnia-induced update.


caitlyn is no more.  well, sort of.  we're trying the friends thing, but i don't honestly know how long that'll last.  meh.  she got kind of overbearing and jealous and made me feel guilty a lot, and that wasn't a good thing.

i found a new job (which i have to go to tomorrow morning) as a server at a japanese-french resto called kyoto.  if any of you know the building that was formerly occupied by big bowl at aspen grove, that's where it is.  stop in, we have really good sushi.

license=soon, in the next week or so.
car=soon after.  german or japanese.


cheers

oh my.  so much has happened.

first: i have a girlfriend.  yes.  i know, impossible.  but it gets better: we both went to heritage at the same time, then she graduated.  her name is caitlyn.

second: hopefully i will be working at starbucks soon.  corporate whore: yes.  but more importantly, broke: yes.  fuckin noodles.

third: actually, there really is no three.  so sue me.

peace out homies.
and it's...

Remember the thing i wrote about me going to Montreal?  Yeah.  Not happening.  Why, you ask?  Well, i'll tell you.




The girl I was going to stay with, (she's on my myspace as *deena) got a boyfriend/fiance thing.  and i seriously doubt he'd be very happy with my staying there.

So here i am with a huge wad of cash.  Hm.  A car, maybe?

i'm just thinking out loud...

i finally am taking a vacation by myself.

AC5768  Denver (DEN)  Chicago (ORD)  Sun 18-Dec  
 
AC520  Chicago (ORD)  Montreal (YUL)  Sun 18-Dec 
 
AC521  Montreal (YUL)  Chicago (ORD)  Sat 24-Dec 
 
AC5785  Chicago (ORD)  Denver (DEN)  Sat 24-Dec  

right.  now all i need is lots and lots of money.

...no, really. Link to the story.
News Corp.'s Place in MySpace By buying Web player Intermix Media and its runaway hit social-networking site, the media conglomerate gains on the Internet giants In less than two years, MySpace has emerged as one of the hottest sites on the Web. It has more page views than Google (GOOG ). And with 22 million members, and a growth rate of 2 million a month, it stands to rival MSN (MSFT ), Yahoo! (YHOO ) and AOL (TWX ) as one of the major destinations on the Web. With a heavy focus on music, it has become a part of daily life for teenagers and young adults nationwide. Members create highly personalized home pages loaded with message boards, blogs, photos, and streaming music and video. People use it to stay in touch with friends and meet other people. Driven by the expressiveness of its members, the social-networking site has emerged as an important channel for online advertising. TV shows and new music are often debuted on MySpace. CAUGHT ON QUICKLY. Now it has drawn even more major attention, in the name of big bucks. On July 18, media conglomerate News Corp. (NWS ) revealed that it's buying Intermix Media (MIX ), the company that owns MySpace and about 30 other sites, for $580 million in cash. Los Angeles-based Intermix owns 53% of MySpace and plans to buy the rest. It will become part of News Corp.'s new Fox Interactive Media unit, which was created on July 15 and also is based in L.A. As word spread of the acquisition, News Corp. stock was practically unchanged in trading on July 18, with shares closing down 2 cents, to $17.45. Shares of Intermix were up 9.5%, to $11.74. "I've been in the Internet space for 12 years, and I've never seen a company grow and catch on at the rate that MySpace has," says Fox Interactive President Ross Levinsohn. The deal reflects Fox's ambitions to establish a premier presence on the Web. REMAKING THE SHOW? MySpace has quickly beat back other social-networking sites such as Friendster. It has more than 14 million unique visitors a month, compared with Friendster's 1 million, according to market researcher comScore Media Metrix. But MySpace CEO Chris DeWolfe and President Tom Anderson have had much more in mind than just being the next Friendster. In an interview with BusinessWeek in May, they expressed a desire to become a lifestyle portal rivaling Yahoo, MSN, and AOL in size. The News Corp. deal could help the MySpace execs realize their ambitions. Fox can contribute massive amounts of capital to the site grow. It already rivals Viacom's (VIA-B ) MTV as the main distribution channel for new releases in the alternative-rock market. It has also proven itself as an ad and marketing medium. The premier of the NBC (GE ) comedy series The Office occurred on MySpace. And Billy Corgan, the singer and former leader of the rock band Smashing Pumpkins, debuted his new solo record, TheFutureEmbrace, on the site. CALIFORNIA SCHEMING. MySpace has the potential to disrupt the ways business is usually done in media and entertainment. "Now that MySpace is here, bands don't necessarily need a label to be heard," Corgan told BusinessWeek Online in an interview in May. If this becomes true for musicians today, it also could be true for filmmakers tomorrow. Why has MySpace succeeded where others have generated buzz but then failed? The answer is, partly, a matter of geography. It emerged from the L.A. music and club scene, drawing on Anderson and DeWolfe's friends for early support. It wasn't concocted by Silicon Valley tech types or New York bankers. It was born in a city that's geared toward media and entertainment, not technology or finance. And like other great exports from Southern California -- such as Hollywood and surfboards -- MySpace tapped into the country's psyche. Where other sites tried to be useful, sensible, and safe, MySpace endeavored to be exciting and fun. The early users included lots of models and musicians. As it happened, MySpace also has exploited technology to the max, making use of blogs before many rivals did. But the technology has always had a point -- allowing users to customize their sites and let their personalities shine through. And MySpace never sought to overly control the often riotous self-expression that followed. "THEY'RE VERY SMART." Levinsohn of News Corp. is careful not to hype the potential synergies. He says he wants to let MySpace go about its business, supporting Anderson and DeWolfe as needed. If it makes sense to launch a new Fox show on MySpace, the company will do it. But it appears to not plan on shoving those synergies down anyone's throat. Plus, News Corp. doesn't expect to shut rival networks and media companies out of MySpace, either. Perhaps the deal's greatest benefit is that it will help Fox spot the next important trend before it gets too big. "They're very smart, and we're going to let them continue to do what they do," says Levinsohn. With this deal, Fox Interactive Media has taken a major step forward, after being overshadowed on the Web by companies such as Yahoo. Fox has a good understanding of what works and what doesn't, and it's willing to invest money and take risks. And the sheer magnitude of the all-cash deal shows that traditional media companies are figuring out that the Net is emerging as a primary channel for the distribution of news and entertainment.

So, remember that job I was...employed in?

I was laid off after three days.  My boss came up to me and was all like "Well, as you can see, business is a bit slow, so since you were hired last, I have to let you go."

It wasn't a total loss.  After that he gave me $100.

I leave on Friday.  Yays.

So I finally have a job.  

I am working at a lame fabric store in Centennial.

$7 an hour for dealing with old ladies.

Leaving in 2 weeks for Chicago.

And Katy won't answer her phone.

That is the end of this update.  There will be more when I think of it.

Cos this world swallows souls
And when the blues unfold
It gets cold silence burns holes
You're going mad
Perhaps you always were
But when things was good you just didn't care
This is called irony
When you most need to get up you got no energy
Time and time shit'll happen
The dark shit's unwrapping
But no-one's listening your mates are laughing
Your brethren's fucking and then you start hating
Your stomach starts churning and you mind starts turning.
So smoke another draw
It won't matter no more but the next day still feels sore
Rain taps on your window
Always did tho but you didn't hear it when things were so-so
You're on your own now
Your little zone you were born alone and believe me you'll die
alone

Just trying to stay positive

Feels nice and still
Good thing about brown is it always will
It's easy, no-one blames you
It's that world out there that's fucked you
You know less of a person and if God exists
He still loves you
Just remember that - the more you sink the further back from
that brink
Maybe you've lifetime scars and you think tattoos might be more
fitting
But who's picking?
Searching for yourself you find demons
Try and be a freeman and grasp that talisman
Cos your the same as I am
We all need our fellow man
We all need our samaritan.
Maybe I'm better looking than you tho
Maybe I've got more dough - but am I happier... no.
Get the love of a good girl and your world will be much richer
than my world
And your happyness will uncurl

Just trying to stay positive

Stop dreaming
People who say that are blaspheming
They're doing nine to five and moaning
And they don't want you succeeding when theyve blown it
And you idols - who are they?
They too dreamt about their day
Positive steps will see your goals.
Whether it's dollars or control, feel the gold.
I aint helping you climb the ladder
I'm busy climbing mine.
That's how it's been since the dawn of time
If you reach a cul-de-sac
The world turns it's back
This is you zone, it's like blackjack
He might get the ace or the top one
So organise your two's and three's into a run then you'll have
fucked him son
And for that you'll be the better one
One last thing before you go though
When you feel better tommorow you'll be a hero
But never forget today. you could be back here
Things can stray
What if you see me in that window?
You won't help me I know.
That's cool, just keep walking where you go.
Carry on through the estate, stare at the geezers so they know
you aint lightweight
And go see your mates
And when they don't look happy
Play them this tape

Just trying to stay positive

I hope you understand me
Just trying to stay positive
I aint no preaching fucker and I aint no do-goody-goody either
This is about when shit goes pear-shaped
And if you aren't or ever have been at rock bottom then good
luck to you in the big wide  world
But remember that one day shit might just start crumbling
Your bird might fuck off or you might lose your job
It's when that happens that what I'm talking about will feel
much more important to you
So if you aint feeling it, just be thankfull that everythings
cool in your world
Respect to BC
Positivity
Positivity

Just trying to stay positive

I have one class left in high school.

Theater Company, 7th hour.  Tomorrow doesn't really count as a day, seeing as how I don't have to show up until around 11.00.

And I really need to find a job so I can start doing tango again.
So I went and saw Mae last night and I must say, it was pretty good stuff. 3 days left! I'll post more when I get home.

Hm. Where to start. I have 7...no, 6.5 days of high school left. That fact is incomprehensably awesome. I called Kat a few days ago. Either she was in a really pissy mood or is just sick of me. The last words I heard from her were "Leave me alone until I call you." Ah well. Ha, I still intend to keep doing tango because now I'm going for the dance and not for her. What a concept... And incidentally, the other girl I was dating, Kate (Aaa too many K's), has gotten back with her ex. But, hey, look on the good side. I have 6 and a half days of HIGH SCHOOL left. Oh, and I played one of these the other day: I want one.
If I have $, I'm going. Think about it. Rally+tango=one hell of a time. Who wants to go with?
I got pr0m pictures back today.  I'll post them up when I get home.

Well, the show went quite well.  It was a show that I think was a good one to go out on.

That's about it.  Except that I broke my wrist at Stella's on Friday.  So ow.

Well, what's new...

I have been absolutely exhausted from rehearsals.  And now it is Hell Week.

Speaking of which, you should all come check out Guys and Dolls.  It's this Thursday, Friday, and Saturday at 7.00 and Saturday at 1.00.  I promise it won't suck.

So...really not much to speak of has been going on.  The show has been taking up most of my time so I haven't been dancing or anything.  Chilled with Nicole last night for her 18th, that was fun.  Mmmm...Breakfast King...

So, that's it.  Bleh.  I'm tired.

Later.

So I definitely called Kate up last night...only it was a different Kate.  I realised this only after I had been talikng to her for about 10 minutes.

Oh, that was fun.
Hahahahahahaha he blows fire and they throw a beer at him!

Hm.  Where to begin.

Went to pr0m last night with Katy.  And I must say, I had the most gorgeous date at that whole shindig.

No exaggeration.

Going to go read poetry tonight, so I'll see you kids later.

I feel
your smoldering breath on my
shoulders as we  move   across   
the dance floor
        I feel
the muscles in the small of your back
pulsating with the beat
of this dance, your body incorporating
perfectly timed movements of
your high-heeled feet and
  seductive legs.
              I feel
the pull of the rhythm
                      taking hold
and the fire in this room
    consuming me!
at this moment
there is no existence
     except for this dance
   no reality but this delicate
     embrace and the intensity
       of your touch.
nothing at all but you, me, and the music.
  Trancelike.
      Weightless.
          Moving as one until
  the music ends.
    Then the passion begins anew
      as another record is put on,
a lonely piano melody.
       As the notes bend and float above the lights
          we move slightly closer to each other
       slip deeper into the moment
          and stalk across the floor.
       Lips brushing my neck.
           the slow piano seeming to
              move the hands on the clock apart
        and extend these few minutes,
                   These
       few remaining measures of music
                   these
         beats counted only by our bodies
            these steps, now slowing...
         but our minds keep dancing.
       keep moving, time marked not in strings,
           but in heartbeats.

You Know You're Addicted to Photoshop When...
You see the world with one eye and stock images with the other. When asked what the primary colors are, answer "RGB" You get the urge to 'fix' poor quality images. You start teaching your significant other to use this "evil" program and in the space of one afternoon convince them it's at least only quasi-evil in the face of PSP. You ramble about a breakthrough in the piece you're doing to people who have no idea in hell what you're talking about You ponder the meaning of existence without layers. You never leave the house without a digicam and notepad. You drop something and your brain tells you automatically "Ctrl-Z! Ctrl-Z!". When you realize it won't work, your brain tells you "Ctrl-Alt-Z! Ctrl-Alt-Z!" You're getting dressed for something important and you look in the mirror and realize you would look so much better if you could just tweak the levels a little and apply a slight gaussian blur. You stop on the street to rant about cheesey effects that should not be on professional posters. You scream out fonts as they appear on TV. You have dreams in "glowing edges" You're standing by the ocean and wondering who used Ocean Ripple. You actually get these jokes and pass them on to other friends who are addicted to Photoshop.


Get Your Own Addicted Meme Here

More cool things for your blog at Blogthings

So.

Got to the Mercury on Friday in time for lessons.  At this point, I can honestly say that I'm hooked on this whole tango thing.  It rocks.

Oh, and I talked to Kat Friday night.  She was on the way in as I was on the way out.  The way I figure, she doesn't hate me, so that's a step in the right direction.

Note to self: stop over-analyzing things.

And a big YAY for snow!!!

GIVE IT TO ME!!! GIVE IT NOW!!! Oh God I want that camera. Erm, in other news, had a pretty good night last night. Went to the Merc, hung out with Trixie. Walked her home...read poetry... You want juicy details? Tough, cos you're not getting any. Hmmm...I also need to figure out what's going on with Allison...weird stuff happened last night, that's for sure. Katy called me at aboot 12.20 last night and we talked the whole train ride back. Apparently she was supposed to be working on some kind of project and needed a distraction(?) Oh, well, it was amusing. later, kids. sparc0

Well, it continues.  My trend of shorter and shorter relationships continues.  This time, I didn't even get one date before she gave up on me.  Ah, well.

Life goes on, c'est la vie.

It needs to snow more.  A <u>lot</u> more.

I loooooove going to Guitar Centre and playing all of the guitars...

Bigger update tomorrow.

OK, because people are retards, starting now, unless something is G-rated, this journal is friends-only.

Comment on this if you want in.

And by the way, if you are going to be a coward and use "anonymous" posting to try and start shit with me, don't bother.

I now have a copy of Gran Turismo 4!!!!

Yeah, so, I need film.

Badly.

Cos I have a shoot tomorrow.  I'm applying for a job at Janssen so I need a portfolio.

I wonder what black & white film tastes like?

My hand is lonely
and craves to embrace yours
to entwine our fingers,
to hold you close.
My angel, my darling,
I miss you so much.
It's been so long, baby, since I felt your touch.
Your beautiful kisses
made my breath leap
but I think there's a promise that I have to keep.
I'll always be there
if you need someone to cry to
someone to hear you,
someone to hold you,
someone to reassure you,
cos we all have grey days.
I've always been attracted
like an unbearable force.
Sometimes I have to check myself
before I fall for you,
step over the edge
into the endless valley of you
that seductive rush
when you know you've fallen hard.
it leaves me wanting
wanting you to want me.
longing to will this attraction
into being.
But I know I can't
force it to.
You told me so long ago
that I needed you
to keep me from falling
into another chasm
I talked to you for an eternity
before I saw your face
you gave me something to hope for
something to believe in
Knowing that a thousand miles,
a million starry nights,
ten thousand words,
and a hundred fulfilling conversations stood between you
and me.
And you wanted me.
So I came to you on my moonlit
silver wings,
you in my head the whole time.
And when I saw you
face to face
I began to fall.
I halted myself though.
But now I wonder
will it ever be okay
to fall into you?

I know now
'cos I am the words.
You have written me down
line by line
in metaphor and simile
you've painted a picture
of me and my ribbons.
In the effortless characters
your graphite blood
renders my soul.
I know now that
you have me figured out.
Not yet completely,
but the threads that I don't have,
the threads that have unraveled,
bits of the tapestry of my mind.
I know now
what's keeping me sane.
A junkie, a slut, a spinner?
A spinner of webs,
of visions and concepts,
imprints of my tattered spirit.
Others whisper curses about her,
voodoo hexes in the twilight.
But they don't know what I know now.
That she's not a whore.
Not from the cold concrete of Colfax and Speer.
Not a junkie.
Getting her fix from the alleys of 15th.
But a beautiful girl.
Who can see past the scars,
past the pain, past the teardrops turned to blood.
Straight through what I was
as if I was the plexiglas
of an old museum case.
To see what I can become.
And she cares for the man inside the boy
aching, yearning to break out,
to return the kindness shown to him,
though he could never care for her
more than he does now.
'cos I know now
why I'm not hopeless
not a Fort Logan inductee
Because of my beautiful junkie.
I know now that she does believe.
Believe in what?
Believe in life,
believe in love,
believe in whatever's inside me.
I still can't figure it out.
All this shit I've been carrying around,
but she's always seen what really matters.
My truly amazing junkie.

Take note:
Valentine's Day and Venereal Disease start with the same letters.

Coincidence?

*strokes his goatee and ponders*

All of these nights without you
I'm sick of being alone.
I think of you next to me,
But it doesn't feel the same.
I want you holding me tight,
Kissing me all through the night,
So I can see the candlelight
Reflecting off your eyes.
I miss your lips on me, babe
And your fingers in my hair.
I miss that wonderful scent
That lets me know you are near.
I miss your lilac kisses,
And your warmth when you are here.
I just wanted you to know
So when the icy night descends,
You'll think of me and you,
And we'll be ablaze again.

Addiction
-----------------------------------------------
I think you've given me withdrawl
Because your kisses
Felt like silk beneath it all
And I know your touch will make me miss
You so terribly tonight
But even more so now I know
I want this to be more than just kisses
Because, darling, I can see there's more below
The beautiful girl I so badly miss
Your neck was like velvet as I kissed it
And I felt you hold your breath
Maybe somehow my feelings can fit
With the kisses of the girl I'm missing to death
I can't stop this addiction to you
I know I can say right now definitively
That I'd want no on in the world
But you lying here next to me
Just like you were tonight when I twirled
Your hair in my fingers
Like so many strands of this lonely night
With your head on my heart
I took your hand and held it tight
Because I think; no, I feel that this is the start
Of the beautiful addiction that you are

I have a lot of stuff I've written in the last week or so that I wanted to get out in the open...show me some lovin' people, give me some feedback.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tonight I write these lines,
And these silver strings will sing
The song of the last time
That you told me to bring
My heart to your place.
So I walked through your door
And kissed your lovely face
I couldn't ask for more.
